cpam 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Fit a changepoint GAM model (internal)

cpgam.Rd

Internal function to fit a generalized additive model (GAM) with changepoint at a specified time. Supports both case-only and case-control designs with negative binomial or gaussian families.

Usage

cpgam(
  data,
  cp,
  regularize,
  model_type = c("case-only", "case-control"),
  bs = "tp",
  family = c("nb", "gaussian"),
  gam_method = "REML",
  gam_optimizer = "efs",
  fixed_effects = NULL,
  sp = NULL,
  k_mult = 1.2,
  n_try = 1,
  not_exp = F,
  silent = T
)

Arguments

data

A data frame containing the time series data

cp

Numeric changepoint time

regularize

Logical; whether to use regularization for negative binomial models

model_type

Character; either "case-only" or "case-control"

bs

Character; basis type. Can be GAM bases ("tp", "null", "lin", "ilin", "dlin") or SCAM bases ("micv", "mdcx", "cv", "cx", "micx", "mdcv")

family

Character; either "nb" (negative binomial) or "gaussian"

gam_method

Character; fitting method for GAM, defaults to "REML"

gam_optimizer

Character; optimization method, defaults to "efs"

fixed_effects

Character; additional fixed effects to include in model formula

sp

Numeric; smoothing parameter(s)

k_mult

Numeric; multiplier for basis dimension k

n_try

Integer; number of fitting attempts

not_exp

Logical; passed to scam::scam

silent

Logical; whether to suppress warnings

Value

A fitted GAM or SCAM model object with additional components:

  • f: model formula

  • cp: changepoint time

  • bs: basis type used

  • data: input data

  • model_type: type of model fitted

  • se_ratio: ratio of maximum standard error to maximum counts

Returns NA if model fitting fails.
